clinical_study.brief_title: Reduction of Post Mastectomy Pain With the Jacki® Recovery Jacket
clinical_study.official_title: Reduction of Post Mastectomy Pain With the Jacki® Recovery Jacket: Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
This research study is studying a garment called the Jacki® recovery jacket that can be worn after surgery as a possible way to manage pain from surgical drains.
The study intervention involved in this study is:
-"Jacki" recovery jacket

detailed_description.textblock:
This research study is a Phase III clinical trial. Phase III clinical trials examine the safety and effectiveness of a drug or treatment, often comparing it to another known treatment.
In this research study, the investigators are studying the Jacki, a garment that can be worn post-mastectomy with pockets that hold post-surgical drains. The Jacki was invented by a cancer survivor who leads A Little Easier Recovery®, a non-profit organization in Massachusetts, and may help participants manage the pain of post-surgical drains to increase comfort and ease of daily living. The jacket has not previously been tested in a research study. The investigators are hoping to learn whether the jacket is effective in reducing pain and discomfort from the time participants leave the hospital until they return to have their drains removed.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain Intensity (on the 0-10 Pain Intensity Numeric Scale)

secondary_outcome.description: Breast cancer module of the European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer, 23 items.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health Related Quality of Life (EORTC QLQ-C30)
secondary_outcome.description: Core quality of life module of the European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer, 30 items.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Patterns At Home (Symptom Distress Scale)
secondary_outcome.description: Pain frequency and intensity in the past week (Symptom Distress Scale, 2 items).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Patterns At Home (PROMIS Pain Intensity Scale)
secondary_outcome.description: Pain intensity in the past week/right now (Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System Pain Intensity Scale, 3 items).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Patterns At Home (PROMIS Pain Interference Scale)
secondary_outcome.description: Pain interference in the past week (Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System Pain Interference With Daily Activities and Social Relations Scale, 8 items).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Management At Home: Use of Pain Medication (Daily Diary: Pain medication 24-hour dosage)
secondary_outcome.description: Participant self-report of 24-hour pain medication dosage, reported daily from discharge to follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Management At Home: Use of Mastectomy Bra or Camisole (Daily Diary: hours/day)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported number of hours per day that participant uses a mastectomy bra or camisole from discharge to follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient-Reported Usage of Jacki Recovery Jacket (Daily Diary: hours/day)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported number of hours per day that participant uses the Jacki recovery jacket from discharge to follow-up.
Post-mastectomy specific list of post-discharge complications including pain, fever, arm/breast symptoms, and impact on activities of daily living and quality of life.

intervention.description: An outer jacket that holds surgical drains and allows access for blood draws
Standard care pain medicine and management in hospitals where the study enrolls

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are ≥ 18 years old.
- Patients who speak and understand English.
- Patients who have had mastectomy with reconstructive surgery in one or both breasts.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Co-morbid delirium
- Dementia
- Mental illness, or neurocognitive deficit prohibiting informed consent and/or ability to complete study procedures.
